text: Hexachloroethane is a chlorinated derivative of ethane with the formula . It is a colourless crystalline solid that sublimates. It was used in smoke bombs and formerly as a parasite medication for animals. It was discovered by Michael Faraday in 1820. Faraday, Michael (1859). Experimental Researches in Chemistry and Physics. p. 40. ISBN 978-0-85066-841-4. ==References==
title: Hexachloroethane
